avdta.network.node

Class PriorityTBR

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.IntersectionControl
      • avdta.network.node.TBR
        • avdta.network.node.PriorityTBR
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MCKSTBR, PhasedTBR, SignalWeightedTBR

    public class PriorityTBR
extends TBR
    This class represents a reservation-based intersection control in which Vehicle movement is determined by their priority. The priority is specified by a IntersectionPolicy instance variable.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class avdta.network.node.TBR

    • Constructor Detail

      • PriorityTBR

        public PriorityTBR()
        Constructs this PriorityTBR with IntersectionPolicy.FCFS and a null intersection. A non-null intersection is required for simulation.

      • PriorityTBR

        public PriorityTBR(IntersectionPolicy policy)
        Constructs this PriorityTBR with the specified IntersectionPolicy and a null intersection. A non-null intersection is required for simulation.
        Parameters:
        policy - the IntersectionPolicy that determines vehicle order

        Parameters:

        policy - the IntersectionPolicy that determines vehicle order

      • step

        public int step()
        Executes one time step of simulation. See the conflict region algorithm. Vehicles that do not have a next Link (some buses) are removed from the network. Vehicles that move are removed from their previous Link (Link.removeVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle) and added to their next Link (Link.addVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle)). This requires that Vehicle.getPrevLink() is the incoming Link and Vehicle.getNextLink() is the outgoing Link. Human-driven vehicles traveling through a reservation must reserve all possible turning movements.
        Specified by:
        step in class IntersectionControl
        Returns:
        the number of exiting vehicles

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this PriorityTBR to restart simulation.
        Overrides:
        reset in class TBR
